seg.input:
Unsern gunstlichen gruͤtz zevor.
Lieber Meister Heinrich, demnach unns angelangt, wie ir leyder schwebender leuffen halben zuͦ Bremgarten abgewichen und, alls wir besorgen, nit vil platzes me da haben werden, gelangt an üch unnser früntlichs begern, ir wöllend üch zuͦ unns alher thuͤn; wöllend wir üch mit billichem stannd, damit ir das evangelion Christi, ob gott will, mit vil frucht in unser statt verkünden mügen, versehen. Daran thuͤnd ir zevor gott unnd unns angenems wolgefallen. Üwere antwort by disem bringer begerende.
Datum zinstags, den 28. tag novembris anno etc. 31°.
Adilberg [!] Meyger, burgermeister unnd rath der stat Basel.
Dem ersamen Meister Heinrichen Bullinger, etwan predicanten zuͦ Bremgarten, unnserm guͤten fründth, jetz zuͦ Zürich.
seg.output:
Our cordial greetings to you.
Dear Master Heinrich, since we have heard that you have left for Bremgarten due to the epidemic, and, as we fear, you will not have much space there, we kindly ask you to come to us. We will provide you with a good standing so that you may preach the gospel of Christ, God willing, with great fruit in our city. In this you would please God and us. We await your answer via this messenger.
Dated, Sunday, 28th day of November, 31st year etc.
Adilberg [!] Meyger, mayor and council of the city of Basel.
To the esteemed Master Heinrich Bullinger, possibly preacher at Bremgarten, our good friend, now at Zurich.
